alert.note: Alert for Central Brewster County; Crane; Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 11:11PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PECOS...NORTHWESTERN BREWSTER... SOUTHEASTERN REEVES...EAST CENTRAL JEFF DAVIS...SOUTHEASTERN WARD AND NORTHWESTERN CRANE COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM CDT... At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Barstow to 12 miles west of Marathon. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Pecos, Fort Stockton, Alpine, Grandfalls, Marathon, Fort Stockton-Pecos County Airport, Toyah Lake, Coyanosa, Imperial Reservoir, Pecos Municipal Airport, Royalty, B F Goodrich Testing Track, Sierra Madera, Firestone Test Track, and Imperial. This includes the following highways... Interstate 10 between mile markers 218 and 278. Interstate 20 near mile marker 41, and between mile markers 44 and 47. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Brewster County; Crane; Davis Mountains; Davis Mountains Foothills; Pecos; Reeves County Plains; Ward
